intro: Coccoloba acuminata var. glabra, commonly known as smooth coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically found in moist, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stem. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round, red berries that are edible. This species is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil conditions.
